summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2019 regarding the scheduling of a meeting with Mark Epstein. The emails show confusion and negotiation between an attorney and a representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York about the meeting date, with the attorney's client (Mark Epstein) described as anxious and flying in from Florida.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; an individual for whom a meeting with investigators is being scheduled. He is described as anxious and flying in from Florida for the meeting.

events.title: Missed Meeting Confusion
events.description: Confusion arises as the U.S. Attorney's Office expected a meeting with Mark Epstein's attorney at 3 p.m., but the attorney states they had not confirmed for that date and had a prior appointment.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: Mark Epstein's attorney proposes and initially believes a meeting with investigators is scheduled for October 31 at 3 p.m., but the U.S. Attorney's Office states they are not available that week.

events.title: Confirmed Meeting
events.description: A meeting is confirmed for November 7, 2019, at 10 a.m. at the office of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein was scheduled to meet with investigators from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in late October/early November 2019.
There was significant confusion and miscommunication between Mark Epstein's attorney and the prosecutors regarding the confirmed meeting date.
Mark Epstein was described as 'quite anxious' and was flying in from Florida for the scheduled meeting.
A meeting was ultimately confirmed for November 7, 2019, at 10 a.m.
The email chain highlights the logistical coordination and attorney-client communications involved in the investigation.
